title: Analyzing Workforce Dynamics and Safety: Insights from an Oil Refinery

text:
Loading Necessary Packages

# For data importing
library(readxl)
# For data manipulation and tidying
library(tidyverse)

# For date and time handling
library(lubridate)

title: Analyzing Workforce Dynamics and Safety: Insights from an Oil Refinery
text:
Importing Data
The dataset for this project was sourced from an Excel file and imported into R using the read_excel() function from the readxl package. The imported data was then inspected and prepared for analysis through a series of cleaning and transformation steps to ensure accuracy and usability.

df <- read_excel("~/git_repos/solanillam/Project_2/Raw_Data/Copy of df_overall_final_V1.xlsx")

Ok, let’s take a look at the data set.

Data Structures and Variables

title: Welcome to My Web Page!
text:
This is my digital portfolio for STT 2860 - Intro to Data Management and Visualization. Here, you’ll find a showcase of the projects and visualizations I’ve created throughout this course. This work reflects my growing proficiency in data analysis, visual storytelling, and statistical tools.
But this portfolio isn’t just about my coursework—you’ll also get to learn more about me, my journey, and how this class has shaped my skills and aspirations.



Data Visualization


Explore More Resources
If you’re interested in diving deeper into data management and visualization, check out the resources and courses offered by Dr. Alan T. Arnholt, the instructor for STT 2860 - Introduction to Data Management and Visualization at Appalachian State University. His materials provide valuable insights into the fundamentals of data science and visualization techniques.
To learn more about his teaching and access helpful resources, click here.

title: About Me
text:
Hello! I’m Mariana Solanilla, a passionate and driven individual who is excited to transition from my academic journey into the professional world. I’m graduating this December with a major in Psychology and a concentration in Human Services and a minor in Leadership Studies. Throughout my studies, I’ve developed a strong interest in understanding how people thrive in organizational settings and how effective leadership can foster a productive and inclusive environment.
Over the years, I’ve gained hands-on experience in human resources, safety analytics, and leadership, which has provided me with a broad set of skills that I’m eager to apply in a full-time role. I’ve worked on projects ranging from HR consulting to research on workplace safety, and I’ve had the opportunity to collaborate with diverse teams in both academic and professional settings.
I’m a first-generation college student with a deep commitment to personal growth, inclusivity, and fostering positive relationships both at work and in my personal life. I’m excited to apply what I’ve learned and continue growing as a professional in the workforce.
In my free time, I enjoy engaging in outdoor activities, photography, and reading to unwind and stay inspired. I look forward to connecting with like-minded professionals and contributing to an organization that values collaboration and innovation.
My Journey in STT 2860
As someone who has always been more drawn to people-oriented fields like psychology and leadership, diving into a course on data management and visualization felt like a bold step. But I’ve discovered just how powerful data can be in telling stories, identifying patterns, and supporting decision-making. This class has taught me to:

Approach challenges with a growth mindset.
See the beauty and creativity in data visualization.
Translate complex information into accessible insights.

Through perseverance and curiosity, I’ve gained a stronger foundation in data analysis, and I’m excited to carry these skills into my future endeavors.



Professional Headshot
